intro: Talauma dixonii, commonly known as the Dixon's talauma, is a rare and little-studied plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Talauma dixonii is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
